td.p: Thomson, John. Journal, Mackenzie River, 1800-1802. An electronic transcription. MFTP #0021

div.p: this year do not kill any Hares – therefore Mr Wentzel writes me that if I want Provissions to carryout the Returns, I must sollicit my Indians for that purpose as I need not expect any from him – that is indeed a hard case for I am very certain my Indians will not perform any such services particularly at this season of the Year & perhaps at any other[.] Consequently God knows in what manner we will be able to perform the different voyages the approaching Summer – for surely I am at a loss[.]
Sunday the 1st February[.] [O]ne of the hunters brought 24 hares[.]
Monday the 2d[.] Wrote Mr Wentzel a long epistle[.]

Tuesday the 3d[.] In the morning sent back Smith & his Indian, gave him a dram, 8lbs grease, 9lbs Pounded Meat & 24lbs Dried Meat[.] Sent by him for Mr Wentzel 64 carribou Collets & 2 Annual Registers – likewise according to his own desire 4 Martins, and Seven fathoms of good Tobacco for his own use[.] The young Men brought only 44 hares, they are continually saying that there is no more hares – & were I to pay any attention to their Stories it's long ago since they would have given over hunting[.]
Thursday the 5th[.] The young Men brought 21 hares[.] Sent them back to set their snares in another quarter[.] The day before yesterday Martin made me a writing Desk[,] gave him a Dram[.]

Saturday the 7th[.] Early in the morning St André[,] 2 young Men & a Boy arrived, gave them drams & pieces of Tobacco. St André is as fatt as an overfeed Hog, he says que il etoit comme le Poission dans l'eau toute L'hyver[.] One of the young Men paid 36 skins Credits, the other 2 owed nothing[.] Traded 26 skins[,] 1½ carribou placotté[,] 2 tongues[,] 1 cascamisk, 1 ps of a Depraille & 1 origl skin shirt – gave them 58 skins on Credit, they promise to come again in the Spring – N.B. they slept 10 nights to come here, they left Six Men behind who had amongst them about 50 Skins[.] St André is come sooner then I expected – however I must keep him to send him to Lac La Pluie[.]
